name: Vaccine Coverage and Disease Burden - WHO (2017)
title: Vaccine Coverage and Disease Burden - WHO (2017)

resources.path: Vaccine Coverage and Disease Burden - WHO (2017).csv

fields.name: BCG immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine in a given year. BCG vaccine protects against Tuberculosis. 
Data sources: Household surveys

fields.name: Hepatitis B (HepB3) immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of hepatitis B vaccine in a given year.
Data sources: Facility reporting system and household surveys

fields.name: DTP3 immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) vaccine in a given year.
Data sources: Facility reporting system and household surveys

fields.name: Polio (Pol3) immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of polio vaccine in a given year. 
Data sources: Facility reporting system and household surveys

fields.name: Measles (MCV) immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Percentage of children under one year of age who have received at least one dose of measles-containing vaccine in a given year. For countries recommending the first dose of measles vaccine in children over 12 months of age, the indicator is calculated as the proportion of children less than 12-23 months of age receiving one dose of measles-containing vaccine.
Data sources: Facility reporting system and household surveys

fields.name: Number of confirmed tetanus cases (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Confirmed total tetanus cases.
Data sources: Surveillance systems

fields.name: Number confirmed polio cases (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Reported cases of laboratory-confirmed polio cases. A polio case is confirmed if wild poliovirus is isolated from stool specimens collected from an Acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) case.
Data sources: Surveillance systems

fields.name: Number of confirmed pertussis cases (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Confirmed pertussis cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included. 
Data sources: Surveillance systems

fields.name: Number of confirmed measles cases (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Confirmed measles cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included.
Data sources: Surveillance systems

fields.name: Number of confirmed diphtheria cases (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Confirmed diphtheria cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included.
Data sources: Surveillance systems

fields.name: Estimated deaths due to tuberculosis per 100,000 population, excluding HIV (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Definition given by WHO is “The estimated number of deaths attributable to tuberculosis (TB) in a given year, expressed as the rate per 100,000 population. Published values are rounded to three significant figures.” 
Data sources: Civil registration with complete coverage and medical certification of cause of death.

fields.name: Estimated number of deaths due to tuberculosis, excluding HIV (WHO 2017)
fields.description:
Definition given by WHO is “The estimated number of deaths attributable to tuberculosis (TB) in a given year. Published values are rounded to two significant figures.” 
Data sources: Civil registration with complete coverage and medical certification of cause of death.
